solution_line_template: Mary started with {initial_books} books and returned {returned_first_batch} so she had {initial_books}-{returned_first_batch} = <<{initial_books}-{returned_first_batch}={books_after_first_return}>>{books_after_first_return} books

She had {books_after_first_return} books and checked out {checked_out_first_new_batch} more books so she had {books_after_first_return}+{checked_out_first_new_batch} = <<{books_after_first_return}+{checked_out_first_new_batch}={books_after_first_checkout}>>{books_after_first_checkout} books

She now has {books_after_first_checkout} books but returned {returned_second_batch} so she has {books_after_first_checkout}-{returned_second_batch} = <<{books_after_first_checkout}-{returned_second_batch}={books_after_second_return}>>{books_after_second_return} books

She had {books_after_second_return} books and checked out {checked_out_second_new_batch} more books so she has {books_after_second_return}+{checked_out_second_new_batch} = <<{books_after_second_return}+{checked_out_second_new_batch}={final_books}>>{final_books} books checked out
